Description: Ostracon, rim fragment of a red-brown pottery shallow dish, the fabric is relatively coarse and red in section, the outer surface is covered with a light-brown slip and the edge of the rim is painted black, remains of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink survive on the exterior.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394396) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394396)
